**NetHack 3.3.1** is the 25th public release of [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") and the 21st by the [DevTeam](/wiki/DevTeam "DevTeam"). It was announced and released on the official NetHack website in October 2000.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Availability

NetHack 3.3.1 is readily available from [the official NetHack website](https://nethack.org/v331/download-src.html).

## Significant changes

NetHack 3.3.1 is principally a bug-fix release.

Notable changes in NetHack 3.3.1 include:

- The [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") quest is redesigned.
- The [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") system is revamped into its modern day incarnation.
- The [Amiga](/wiki/Amiga "Amiga") and [Atari](/wiki/Atari "Atari") ports are resurrected.
- A very large number of general fixes.

## The adventurer

The player may choose from these roles and races:

| Role                                              | Races                  | Alignments       |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------- | ---------------- |
| [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") | human, dwarf, gnome    | Lawful, Neutral  |
| [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian")          | human, orc             | Neutral, Chaotic |
| [Cave(wo)man](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")            | human, dwarf, gnome    | Lawful, Neutral  |
| [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer")                   | human, gnome           | Neutral          |
| [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                   | human                  | Lawful           |
| [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk")                         | human                  | Any              |
| [Priest(ess)](/wiki/Priest "Priest")              | human, elf             | Any              |
| [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                   | human, elf, gnome, orc | Neutral, Chaotic |
| [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue")                      | human, orc             | Chaotic          |
| [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")                | human                  | Lawful           |
| [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                | human                  | Neutral          |
| [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")             | human, dwarf           | Lawful, Neutral  |
| [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                   | human, elf, gnome, orc | Neutral, Chaotic |

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the Valkyrie which will always start as female.

The adventurer has [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience"), [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), [magical energy](/wiki/Magical_energy "Magical energy"), [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), and the six major [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute"). They may advance to [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 30.

The initial [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") for Cavemen, Rangers, and Samurai, a [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") for Wizards, a [saddled](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle") [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony") for Knights, and a random choice of a kitten or little dog for all others (or the user's choice in their [options](/wiki/Options "Options")).

## Dungeon features

The main trunk of the dungeon begins at level 1, where the game begins, and proceeds down [stairs](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") to [Medusa's Lair](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Lair "Medusa's Lair") and the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). From there, it is necessary to enter a [trap door](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door") to the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"). Further stairs down eventually lead to the invocation level. Performing the [invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual") at the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") opens the stairs to the [Sanctum](/wiki/Sanctum "Sanctum").

With the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") in hand, the adventurer may ascend from level 1 into the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth"); thence they may proceed through [magic portals](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the planes of [Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), [Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire"), and [Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water"), and thence to the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"). Offering the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") on the correct [high altar](/wiki/High_altar "High altar") wins the game.

Along the way, one will encounter these branches and special levels:

- A second [staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") to the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"), which contains [Mine Town](/wiki/Mine_Town "Mine Town") and a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") at the bottom level.

* The [Oracle level](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)").

- An upward [staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") to [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban").

* A possible [Big Room](/wiki/Big_Room "Big Room").

- The [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level").

* The [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest").

- A possible [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") inside a [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault"), leading to [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios").

* [Medusa's Lair](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Lair "Medusa's Lair").

- The [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").

* The [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"). [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") begins here, and it is no longer safe to [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray").

- The lairs of [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus"), [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex"), [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub"), and [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus").

* A second upward [staircase](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").

- The [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower"); it is visible but not accessible from here.

* A [Fake Tower](/wiki/Fake_Tower "Fake Tower") containing a random [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), and another containing a [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") by which the Wizard's Tower may be entered.

To win the game, it is necessary to complete these tasks:

- Gather seven candles, possibly in [Izchak](/wiki/Izchak "Izchak")'s [lighting shop](/wiki/Lighting_shop "Lighting shop") in [Mine Town](/wiki/Mine_Town "Mine Town").

* Complete the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") and get the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening").

- Obtain the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation") from [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler").

* Obtain the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead") from the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor").

- Proceed to the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") and perform the [invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual").

* Obtain the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") from the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch").

- Escape from the dungeon.

* Pass through the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes").

- Arrive at the correct [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") in the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

* Offer the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") to the god of your [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment").

A [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") is guaranteed in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), in its modern position, protected by [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") and a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest").

All amulets appear as "; tiles are [![Circular amulet.png](/images/8/8b/Circular_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Circular_amulet.png) [![Spherical amulet.png](/images/4/40/Spherical_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Spherical_amulet.png) [![Oval amulet.png](/images/a/a0/Oval_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Oval_amulet.png) [![Triangular amulet.png](/images/d/d5/Triangular_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Triangular_amulet.png) [![Pyramidal amulet.png](/images/e/ec/Pyramidal_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Pyramidal_amulet.png) [![Square amulet.png](/images/9/9a/Square_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Square_amulet.png) [![Concave amulet.png](/images/b/ba/Concave_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Concave_amulet.png) [![Hexagonal amulet.png](/images/3/32/Hexagonal_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Hexagonal_amulet.png) [![Octagonal amulet.png](/images/0/0d/Octagonal_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Octagonal_amulet.png).

NetHack 3.3.1 is the 25th public release of NetHack and the 21st by the DevTeam. It was announced and released on the official NetHack website in October 2000.[1]

Availability

NetHack 3.3.1 is readily available from the official NetHack website.

Significant changes

NetHack 3.3.1 is principally a bug-fix release.

Notable changes in NetHack 3.3.1 include:

  • The Ranger quest is redesigned.
  • The warning system is revamped into its modern day incarnation.
  • The Amiga and Atari ports are resurrected.
  • A very large number of general fixes.

The adventurer

The player may choose from these roles and races:

Role Races Alignments
Archeologist human, dwarf, gnome Lawful, Neutral
Barbarian human, orc Neutral, Chaotic
Cave(wo)man human, dwarf, gnome Lawful, Neutral
Healer human, gnome Neutral
Knight human Lawful
Monk human Any
Priest(ess) human, elf Any
Ranger human, elf, gnome, orc Neutral, Chaotic
Rogue human, orc Chaotic
Samurai human Lawful
Tourist human Neutral
Valkyrie human, dwarf Lawful, Neutral
Wizard human, elf, gnome, orc Neutral, Chaotic

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the Valkyrie which will always start as female.

The adventurer has experience, hit points, magical energy, armor class, alignment, and the six major attributes. They may advance to experience level 30.

The initial pet is a little dog for Cavemen, Rangers, and Samurai, a kitten for Wizards, a saddled pony for Knights, and a random choice of a kitten or little dog for all others (or the user's choice in their options).

Dungeon features

The main trunk of the dungeon begins at level 1, where the game begins, and proceeds down stairs to Medusa's Lair and the Castle. From there, it is necessary to enter a trap door to the Valley of the Dead. Further stairs down eventually lead to the invocation level. Performing the invocation ritual at the vibrating square opens the stairs to the Sanctum.

With the Amulet of Yendor in hand, the adventurer may ascend from level 1 into the Plane of Earth; thence they may proceed through magic portals to the planes of Air, Fire, and Water, and thence to the Astral Plane. Offering the Amulet of Yendor on the correct high altar wins the game.

Along the way, one will encounter these branches and special levels:

  • A second staircase to the Gnomish Mines, which contains Mine Town and a luckstone at the bottom level.
  • The Oracle level.
  • An upward staircase to Sokoban.
  • A possible Big Room.
  • The Rogue level.
  • The magic portal to the Quest.
  • A possible magic portal inside a vault, leading to Fort Ludios.
  • Medusa's Lair.
  • The Castle.
  • The Valley of the Dead. Gehennom begins here, and it is no longer safe to pray.
  • The lairs of Asmodeus, Juiblex, Baalzebub, and Orcus.
  • A second upward staircase to Vlad's Tower.
  • The Wizard's Tower; it is visible but not accessible from here.
  • A Fake Tower containing a random amulet, and another containing a magic portal by which the Wizard's Tower may be entered.

To win the game, it is necessary to complete these tasks:

  • Gather seven candles, possibly in Izchak's lighting shop in Mine Town.
  • Complete the Quest and get the Bell of Opening.
  • Obtain the Candelabrum of Invocation from Vlad the Impaler.
  • Obtain the Book of the Dead from the Wizard of Yendor.
  • Proceed to the vibrating square and perform the invocation ritual.
  • Obtain the Amulet of Yendor from the high priest of Moloch.
  • Escape from the dungeon.
  • Pass through the Elemental Planes.
  • Arrive at the correct altar in the Astral Plane.
  • Offer the Amulet of Yendor to the god of your alignment.
